data.title: Burgers, fries, shakes
data.text: Are you kidding?!  Great authentic and fresh burgers, dogs, fries and shakes.  Fish tacos? Yes!  Great patio across the street from Walnut Park!

data.title: Walk up burger stand
data.text: Not bad for vegetarians.  The veggie burgers are pretty good.  The sides are awesome though.  Sweet potato fries are exceptional.  They also have onion rings, fries, and some other choices.  In summer, I will try a shake.  Will add this to the rotation.  Reasonably priced, not cheap though, but this is pretty good food.  Nice location.

data.title: Worth the Wait.  Get the Walnut Park Cheeseburger for $7.52
data.text:
I was #1 in line and it still took 5 minutes to get the burger.  Worth the wait.  Two 4-ounce patties, cheddar cheese.  You have to put your own ketchup and mustard on the finished product.
A full meal, fresh onions, tomatoes and lettuce.  Juicy all-natural organic meat from a local farm.

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: Look, it can take a little while to get our food since they make it when you order it.  But everything we've had there is very good.  You're just getting hamburgers, hot dogs and fries, but its all well done.  There's no indoor seating, just plastic tables outside.  Its perfect for what it is.

data.title: Excellent food if you have incredible patience
data.text:
Confession: I used to live about a block from Walnut Grill. I've probably eaten here, oh, fifty times. It's good. I think it used to be better, when I lived perhaps five blocks from here years before, when it had the best milk shakes in the world, but it's still really good. I've almost always just ordered the Veggie Burger or a turkey burger of some kind.

But seriously, it takes forever. It can take twenty to thirty minutes for a walk-up stand. The Walnut Grill's slowness was serious. I used to bring a book and sit in Walnut Park just to wait for my order. Still, when you get it, it's perfectly suitable. Thus said, it's nothing to write home to mom about AND its milkshakes are good but nowhere near as fabulous as its predecessor. However, it's a cool old drive-in, so for ambiance alone, that's a bonus. A little pricey for a former drive-in burger joint though. Still, solid.

data.title: Great Burger
data.text: When I was a kid this place was known as PDQ, home of 19 cent burgers and 19 cent fries....today the walnut grill puts out freshly made burgers and fries that easily trump the food at the old PDQ.....the food is fresh and cooked to order, so expect to wait a few minutes for your food to be prepared.....they seemed short staffed this visit and things came out slower than usual and sat undelivered for several minutes...the French burger was delicious, but the order of fries had cooled substantially....a big no no as far as I'm concerned....still, the food is generally very good and I like supporting a hard working local family trying to make a living in a tough business.....worth a visit

data.title: Tasty
data.text: Delicious burgers and tasty hot dogs are served here. It's fun to take your food across the road and eat in the adjacent park.

data.title: Great Hamburger Stand
data.text:
Great hamburgers made to order.  Nothing is sitting on a rack waiting to be sold.  Convenient to the park, hence the name.  Walk-up order window.  All seating is outside.  Nothing fancy but the food is worth returning for.
I'm a regular visitor from out-of-state and look forward to a visit to the Grill this February during my next trip to Petaluma/Sonoma County.

data.title: Food is very good but far from "fast"
data.text: This little burger stand is a Petaluma institution that has gone through many transformations over the years. 30 years ago it was "PDQ" and you could buy burgers by the bag. It had a long run as "Quinleys" and more recently it is the Walnut Park Grill. It's been spruced up so looks charmingly 'retro' rather than run down, and the menu has been updated and elevated. The food is consistently good. Good burgers, a really good (and inexpensive) fish taco, great shakes, dogs, etc.. They are however SLOW. I get it that they are cooking to order, but it never fails to amaze me at just how long it takes. I guess it's a good sign - means everything is being cooked starting with completely raw food? Maybe it wouldn't seem like such a wait in a sit down restaurant? If you aren't absolutely starving, in a big hurry or it isn't freezing cold outside, then this place is definitely worth it.

data.title: Вкусный сытный обед
data.text: Обедали в этом ресторане на второй день пребывания в Петалуме. Времени было в обрез, но обслужили нас и пообедали мы быстро. Вкусные гамбургеры с курицей, овощами и преправами,  суп, овощной салат и пиво. Очень сытно и недорого. Внутри очень приятно, нежарко и просторно. Рекомендую!
